<<<<<<< HEAD
By the Quene the Quenes Maiestie vnderstandyng that where of late the peece of golde called the pistolet was made currant at fyue shyllynges and ten pence ... England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I) Elizabeth I, Queen of England, 1533-1603.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
Imprinted by Richard Iugge and Iohn Cawood, printers to the Quenes Maiestie, London : [1560]
Formerly STC 7919. Line 1 of text ends "late". Space for the cut of second coin left blank, with cut from 7920 pasted over ms. "apologie". Other title information from first 3 lines of text. "Anno 1560. 2. Novembris. The seconde yere of her Maiesties raigne." "Cum priuilegio Regiæ Maiestatis." Reproduction of original in: British Library.
=======
By the Quene the Quenes Maiestie vnderstandyng that where of late the peece of golde called the pistolet was made currant at fyue shyllynges and ten pence ... England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I) Elizabeth I, Queen of England, 1533-1603.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
Imprinted by Richard Iugge and Iohn Cawood, printers to the Quenes Maiestie, London : [1560]
Formerly STC 7919. Line 1 of text ends "late". Space for the cut of second coin left blank, with cut from 7920 pasted over ms. "apologie". Other title information from first 3 lines of text. "Anno 1560. 2. Novembris. The seconde yere of her Maiesties raigne." "Cum priuilegio Regiæ Maiestatis." Reproduction of original in: British Library.
